alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:09AM EST until February 18 at 6:09AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. Buck Creek at Grandville affecting Kent County. .Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell overnight across the area. In addition, much of the snow on the ground has rapidly melted, adding to the amount of water reaching the rivers and streams. Several small and medium-sized rivers have risen out of their banks and are into minor flood levels. For the Sycamore Creek...including Holt...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buck Creek...including Grandville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buck Creek at Grandville. * WHEN...From this morning through late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Water spills into parking lots at Brookcrest Retirement Community. Widespread flooding of yards starts to occur on the lower parts of the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Thursday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued Friday morning, or earlier if conditions warrant.
